Greetings to Ghanaian President 
    Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Ghanaian President John Agyekum Kufuor on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of the independence of Ghana.
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

Congratulations to Palestinian Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Ahmed Qurey upon his remaining in office as prime minister of the Palestinian National Authority.
 The message sincerely wished the Palestinian people and him successes in their work to restore their legitimate national rights.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Nasser al Qedwa upon his appointment as foreign minister of the Palestinian National Authority.

Expulsion of Japanese Ambassador to S. Korea Demanded
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Cultural and Tourism Committee  of the "National Assembly" of south Korea on Feb. 28 requested the government  to expel the Japanese ambassador to south Korea for his reckless remark that "Tok Islet belongs to the Japanese territory", according to south Korean MBC.
 Accusing Japan of insisting that the islet belongs to its territory, the committee adopted a resolution demanding a total reexamination of the function for cultural exchange titled "Year of friendship" with Japan slated to be held this year in retaliation against such behavior.    
 The resolution made it clear that the islet is part of the inalienable territory of Korea, demanding the Japanese government own its full responsibility for the absurd remark of the Japanese ambassador and take an appropriate measure in this regard.

U.S. Report on Human Rights Blasted in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification reportedly made public a statement condemning the U.S. report on human rights on March 2.
  Recalling that the U.S. Department of State in an "annual report on human rights" on February 28 pulled up the north over the human rights issue, the statement vehemently castigated the report in the name of all Koreans in the south and the north and overseas.    
 The United States, warmonger and the very one responsible for abusing human rights, has no right to talk about the human rights issue of other countries, the statement said, stressing: For the guarantee of genuine human rights the U.S. should begin with dropping its unilateral and offensive supremacy.
